paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Endemic populations in Portugal, Japan, and Sweden

individual_records.evidence_sentence: V30M is the most common ATTR mutation worldwide and is endemic in Portugal, Japan and Sweden.
In Sweden, where the age of onset is later than in Portugal, penetrance of ATTRV30M is reported to be less than 50%.

functional_data.summary: The V30M mutation leads to misfolding and aggregation of TTR protein, causing amyloid fibril formation.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in endemic regions.
variants.population_frequency: Endemic in Portugal, Japan, and Sweden; approximately 80% penetrance in early-onset cases.
variants.additional_notes: V30M is associated with a high penetrance in specific populations.
key_quotes: Penetrance of ATTRV30M is reported to be less than 50%, compared with 80% penetrance in the early-onset Portuguese population.

patients.demographics: Late-onset cases, primarily in older adults

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Certain TTR mutations primarily cause cardiac amyloidosis, the most common worldwide being ATTRV122I.
Penetrance of ATTRT60A is difficult to define as age of onset of disease is in the 60s.

functional_data.summary: The L60A mutation affects the stability of the TTR tetramer, leading to increased amyloidogenicity.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in late-onset cases.
variants.population_frequency: Not well characterized; primarily observed in older adults.
key_quotes: Penetrance of ATTRT60A is difficult to define as age of onset of disease is in the 60s.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for TTR variants were extracted successfully.
